choices.text:
Python program
Define a function named largest_difference that takes a list of numbers as its only parameter.
Your function should compute and return the difference between the largest and smallest number in the list.
Here is your code snippet to solve this problem.  Please copy it into an editor, then use Python's "print" statement (or another print-like command) on a line by itself before or after each of these lines so that you can see what happens when they are executed one at time in the interpreter:
def largest_difference(list): 
    largest = 0 # initialize variable to store max difference between any two numbers  in list (smallest - largesst) 
# loop through all elements and compare each with next element, incrementing diff if larger than current value of large.   Save the new maximum in 'large' for use later as largest_difference 
    for i in range(len(list)-1): # iterate over every item except last one (which is already known)
        if list[i] >  list [i+1]:# if current element larger than next, increment diff and save new max value of large for return later.   Note that this will only work when the first two elements in 'large' are 0 
            largest = abs(int (max((abs(x) + 1 ) / 2)) # calculate difference between largest & smallest number
        else:  # else if current element is smaller than next, just increment diff and save new max value of large for return later.   Note that this will only work when the first two elements in 'large' are 0 
            largest = abs(int (max((abs(x) + 1 ) / 2)) # calculate difference between largest & smallest number
    return  largest
